author: Staff
title: High school sports roundup
text:
High school sports roundup updated Wednesday, October 21, 2015 - 11:24pm 
BOGART | For the fourth consecutive season, the Prince Avenue Christian softball team is headed for Columbus. 
The Wolverines (17-7) easily disposed of Fellowship Christian in the first round of the Class A Private state softball tournament Wednesday, winning the opener 15-0 in three innings and qualifying for the elite eight with a 11-2 victory in the nightcap. 
In the first game, Emmy Soles pitched a no-hitter with eight strikeouts. Prince Avenue had 10 hits and was led by Skylar Sparr (two hits) and Mackenzie Kurt (one hit, three RBIs). 
In Game 2, Ansley Bowen earned the pitching victory, giving up three hits and striking out 13. The Wolverines again had 10 hits and were led by Sam Smith (two hits) Sparr (two hits) and Kurt (two hits). 
Prince Avenue Christian, the No. 3 seed in the state tournament, will face Stratford Academy today in the opening round in Columbus. Fellowship Christian’s season ends at 12-12. 
EAST JACKSON ADVANCES 
At Blackshear, East Jackson advanced to the Class AAA elite eight with a sweep over Pierce County. The Eagles won the opener 6-2 and eliminated Pierce County with a 2-1 victory in the second round of the Class AAA state tournament. This marks East Jackson’s first trip to Columbus. 
Jessie Marvin was the winning pitcher in both games for East Jackson. In the first game, she gave up nine hits and two earned runs and struck out eight. In the second game, Marvin allowed four hits and no earned runs and struck out nine. 
Lauren Barrett led the offense in the opener with two hits and two RBIs. Faith Grooms added two hits, Marvin had two hits and Ashlie Wuertley had two hits for the Eagles, who finished with 11 hits and scored five runs in the second inning to put the game away. 
In the second game, Barrett and Grooms, who had three RBIs, drove in East Jackson’s runs. 
The Eagles (25-10), the No. 3 seed from Region 8-AAA, will play a to-be-determined opponent today in Columbus. 
NORTH OCONEE SPLITS 
At Covington, Caroline Miller drove in the game-winning run in the ninth inning of the second game as North Oconee defeated Eastside 3-2 in nine innings to split a doubleheader in the second round of the Class AAAA state tournament. 
Eastside won the opener 2-1, holding off the Titans, who had the tying run on third base in the top of the seventh. 
In the second game, Eastside took a 1-0 lead and North Oconee scored in the bottom of the seventh inning to go to extra innings. Both teams scored in the eighth and Miller ended it with an RBI single in the ninth. Katie Foote earned the pitching victory. 
North Oconee and Eastside will play for a berth to Columbus at 6 p.m. today. 
BLESSED TRINITY SWEEPS 
At Roswell, Oconee County was eliminated from the Class AAA state tournament, losing a doubleheader to Blessed Trinity in the second round. 
The Titans (22-10), the top seed from Region 4-AAA, defeated the Warriors 5-3 in the opener and 6-3 in the elimination game. 
In Game 1, Oconee recorded 12 hits and was led by Chloe Fambrough’s three hits. She was followed by Ansley Hart (two hits), Jessie Michael (two hits, one RBI), McKenzie Pollock (two hits) and Hanna Manders (two hits). Maura Grace Dickens also added a hit. 
Michael took the pitching loss, working six innings and allowing six hits and one earned run to go with three walks and three strikeouts. 
In Game 2, the Warriors posted eight hits and were led by Manders, who had two hits and a run. Hart added a hit and an RBI, as did Dickens. Michael sustained the loss, pitching seven innings with 12 hits and six earned runs to go with one strikeout. 
Oconee County, the No. 2 seed from Region 8-AAA, finishes the season at 17-15. 
VOLLEYBALL: SEEDINGS, SCHEDULES ANNOUNCED 
Four Athens area teams advanced to their respective elite eights and learned Wednesday evening of their seedings and next opponents. 
In Class A, Athens Academy (36-2) is a No. 5 seed and will play at Fellowship Christian — the No. 4 seed — on Saturday in the third round. The Spartans are riding a 26-match winning streak dating back to late August. Fellowship Christian (33-8) has won eight consecutive matches. 
Athens Academy defeated Whitfield Academy and Eagle’s Landing Christian in the first two rounds of the state tournament. 
In Class AAA, Oconee County and Jefferson will meet familiar opponents Saturday — each other. The Warriors (30-12) are the No. 3 seed and will host Jefferson (36-7), the No. 6 seed. The two teams have met three times thus far this season, with Oconee County winning all three, including the finals of the Region 8-AAA tournament. 
Oconee County was the No. 1 seed from its region and defeated South Atlanta and West Hall in the first two rounds. Jefferson was the No. 2 seed from the region and advanced to the third round with victories over North Clayton and East Hall. 
In Class AAAA, North Oconee is a No. 4 seed and will host fifth-seeded Woodward Academy on Saturday. The Titans (36-8) were the No. 2 seed in Region 8-AAAA and defeated Redan and Northwest Whitfield in the first two rounds. Woodward (29-17) was the No. 2 seed in Region 5-AAAA. 
— Staff reports
